bibl.title: William Warden v. O. D. Butterfield. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

div1.p:
In the District Court,
Of the Third Judical District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the County of King.
HABEAS CORPUS.

The People of the United States of America, to O H Butterfield Chief of Police + James Bogart, and other officers of the jail the Sheriff of King County Greeting:
We command you, that you have the body of William Warden by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with this time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said William Warden shall be called or charged, before the HON. C. H. Hanford Richard A. Jones Judge of the aforesaid Court at the Court House in the City of Seattle King County W. T. at the chambers of said Judge forthwith to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning him the said William Warden And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS The HON. RICHARD A. Jones C H Hanford Judge of said District Court, and the seal thereof this 25th day of May A. D. 1889. R. M. Hopkins Clerk. By Deputy Clerk.

E T
No. 6858
In the District Court, Third Judicial District, Holding Terms at Seattle, W. T.
In the Matter of the Application of William Warden
For Writ of Habeas Corpus.
HABEAS CORPUS.
Returned and filed this 25 day of May A. D. 1889 R. M. Hopkins Clerk. By H. T. Hannon Deputy Clerk.
